title: Installation​
content: Flashcast is up on Wally. You can install it simply by putting this in your wally.toml file Flashcast = "synpixel/flashcast@0.5.0"

title: StepCallback​
content: </> type StepCallback = ( raycast: Raycast, deltaTime: number ) → Result? Takes a Raycast instance and delta time and gives back a Result

title: Raycast​
content: </> interface Raycast { position: Vector3 direction: Vector3 raycastParams?: RaycastParams results: {RaycastResult}-- RaycastResults ordered from earliest to latest state: { lastTick: number, distanceTraveled: number, touched?: RaycastResult, [any]: any }-- for preserving state throughout the raycasting tick: number-- by default the Flashcast instance's tick }

title: Result​
content: </> Flashcast.Result: {Stop} Different results (outcomes) of step callbacks

title: worldRoot​
content: </> Flashcast:worldRoot(worldRoot: WorldRoot ) → Flashcast Overrides the default WorldRoot (Workspace)

title: tick​
content: </> Flashcast:tick(tick: number) → Flashcast Configures the amount of rays cast per second

title: beforeStep​
content: </> Flashcast:beforeStep(step: StepCallback) → Flashcast Adds a step callback scheduled to run before calculations

title: afterStep​
content: </> Flashcast:afterStep(step: StepCallback) → Flashcast Adds a step callback scheduled to run after calculations

title: onStepNoTick​
content: </> Flashcast:onStepNoTick(step: StepCallback) → Flashcast Adds a callback scheduled to run on every step regardless of the tick set, should not be used for expensive operations

title: spatialQuery​
content: </> Flashcast:spatialQuery(query: ( raycast: Raycast, deltaTime: number ) → RaycastResult?) → Flashcast Overrides the default spatial query (WorldRoot.Raycast)

title: cast​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> Flashcast:cast( origin: Vector3 , direction: Vector3 , raycastParams?: RaycastParams, defaultState?: {[any]: any} ) → Raycast This will yield until one of the step callbacks returns Result.Stop
